intro: Mimulopsis alpina, commonly known as the alpine mimulus, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It is a member of the family Rutaceae, which includes citrus plants, and is characterized by its small, yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or alpine environments, thriving in well-drained soils at high elevations. It has a compact growth habit with hairy leaves that help reduce water loss in harsh climates. Mimulopsis alpina is often found in alpine meadows and is adapted to withstand cold temperatures and strong winds.
